title.value: Device-Free Human State Estimation using UWB Multi-Static Radios
title.justification: The title is provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Device-Free Human State Estimation using UWB Multi-Static Radios

extractions.description: The paper presents a framework for human state estimation in indoor environments using Ultra-Wide Band (UWB) sensors. The system can estimate the location, activities, and number of people in a given area without requiring them to carry any specific device. This is achieved by leveraging convolutional deep neural networks that map UWB Channel Impulse Responses (CIRs) to precise estimates of human location and activity.

type.justification: The paper is based on experimental results and showcases a real-world application using collected data.
type.quote: We show that we can quickly fine-tune our model for new out-of-distribution users, a process that requires only a few minutes of data and a few epochs of training.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is estimating human state using UWB sensors.
name.quote: we present a human state estimation framework that allows us to estimate the location, and even the activities, of people in an indoor environment without the requirement that they carry specific devices

name.justification: The paper involves estimating the location of people in an indoor environment.
